verses.roman:
sa taṁ gṛhītvā prapador
bhrāmayitvaika-pāṇinā
cikṣepa tṛṇa-rājāgre
bhrāmaṇa-tyakta-jīvitam

synonyms: saḥ—He; tam—him; gṛhītvā—seizing; prapadoḥ—by the hooves; bhrāmayitvā—whirling around; eka-pāṇinā—with a single hand; cikṣepa—He threw; tṛṇa-rāja-agre—into the top of a palm tree; bhrāmaṇa—by the whirling; tyakta—giving up; jīvitam—his life.
translation: Lord Balarāma seized Dhenuka by his hooves, whirled him about with one hand and threw him into the top of a palm tree. The violent wheeling motion killed the demon.
